meanings.sent1: The proliferation of flowers in the garden was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The proliferation of online shopping has changed the way we buy things.
meanings.sent3: The proliferation of squirrels in the park led to a nut shortage!
meanings.sent4: The proliferation of ideas in her mind was like a garden blooming with creativity.
meanings.sent5: The rapid proliferation of stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The news about the sale proliferation quickly throughout the town.
meanings.sent2: Rumors tend to proliferation in small communities.
meanings.sent3: The laughter seemed to proliferation through the room like a contagious virus.
meanings.sent4: His influence began to proliferation like wildfire among the youth.
meanings.sent5: The excitement started to proliferation among the crowd waiting for the concert.

meanings.definition: Multiplication or reproduction of cells or organisms
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the proliferation of cancer cells to the patient.
meanings.sent2: The rapid proliferation of bacteria in the petri dish was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The proliferation of ants in the kitchen made her consider calling the exterminator.
meanings.sent4: The proliferation of fish in the pond created a balanced ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The proliferation of rabbits in the field was a sign of a healthy environment.
